results.title: Tim Burton official opening : Tim Burton : the exhibition
results.brief_description: This film highlights the excitement and celebration of the official opening of ‘Tim Burton: the exhibition’. A night filled with colour and sound. Amongst the fire eaters, stilt walkers and burlesque performers were the Tim Burton fans waiting to get a glimpse of their idol. The festivities start with the red carpet for VIPs that ran along the Flinders Street entrance and eventually inside ACMI’s Lightwell the official opening speeches were delivered.

results.title: Tim Burton @ ACMI : Highlights of Tim Burton's visit to ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a highlights package of Tim Burton’s time at ACMI. It showcases the events that Tim Burton participated in as well as the peripheral activities that occurred around the Exhibition set up and launch. A celebration of Tim Burton and the exhibition, it includes footage of Tim Burton meeting with the young tour guides, book signings, the masses that filled Federation Square to see the sold out event of Tim Burton’s Masterclass, Burton Club, Media Launch, Official Opening as well behind the scenes footage of installations such as the BatMobile and Balloon Boy.

results.title: Tilt
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and World Bank
results.brief_description: A wryly amusing, surrealistic animation using the analogy of the Earth to a ball in a pinball machine being manipulated by pressures arising from inequitable allocation of resources. Emphasises the urgency of finding suitable solutions to the Earth’s problems, how a little more sharing of wealth by the “have” countries might ease many of the world’s economic ills and presents three alternatives. Script by Don Arioli.

results.title: Tikki Tikki Tembo
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: In this charming old Chinese fairy tale, we learn why Chinese parents today give their children little short names instead of great long names. This fable with a moral will delight viewers young and old.

results.title: Tightrope dancer
results.brief_description: Vali Myers is larger than life, or perhaps it’s better to say as large as life. An extraordinary artist and adventurer, her work and philosophies reflect a wild primal spirit that no country or society can contain. At 59, Vali moves between the wilds of her Italian home near Salerno and a hip, limousined, sophisticated life in New York. A leading dancer with a modern dance company at the age of 18, she left Australia for Europe to become a street waif, passing through opium addiction and finally finding relief and peace in her own art. Her flamboyance and her desire to live to the fullest has led her to become a sought after personality.

results.title: Tiger shikar in India (D)
results.creator_credit: Ellis R. Duncan, Frank Ferrin and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description:
An American film man tells of a tiger shooting expedition in northern India. Describes the facilities for big game hunters, and shows shooting from the back of an elephant and from a hide in a tree.
WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Tiger shikar (D)
results.brief_description:
Two tiger hunts in northern India. In the first, villagers go after a man-eater which threatens their safety, using b eaters, nets and spears to surround, trap and kill the tiger. In the second, big-game hunters from overseas, riding elephants and accompanied by beaters, shoot tigers for sport.
NB: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Tiger at the gate
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “History in action”.
Aldolf Hitler was imprisoned for his part in an abortive military coup in 1924. Released nine months later, Hitler began to rebuild the fragments of the National Socialist Party. At the General Election of 1930, the Nazi Party became the second largest party in the Reichstag. This program profiles the developments that gave Hitler and the Nazi’s popular support, and the means they used to broaden and consolidate their power.
